greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of solutions to x^2 + y^2 + z^2 = n in positive integers.
link: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000
mathematica: r[n_] := Reduce[ x>0 && y>0 && z>0 && x^2 + y^2 + z^2 == n, {x, y, z}, Integers]; a[n_] := Which[rn = r[n]; rn === False, 0, Head[rn] === Or, Length[rn], True, 1]; Table[a[n], {n, 0, 89}](* _Jean-François Alcover_, May 10 2012 *)
(EllipticTheta[3, 0, x] - 1)^3/8 + O[x]^100 // CoefficientList[#, x]& (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Jul 30 2017 *)
results.author: Andrew A. Doroshev (andy(AT)ip.rsu.ru), Aug 23 2001
